wikipedia_page.main: Matthew Lewis Vaughan-Davies, 1st Baron Ystwyth (17 December 1840 – 21 August 1935) was a Welsh Liberal Party politician. He was Liberal MP for the Cardiganshire Division from 1895 until 1921.

link_mentions.page: List of United Kingdom MPs: V

response: *Matthew Vaughan-Davies, 1st Baron Ystwyth (1840–1935), Liberal MP for Cardiganshire (1895–1921)Harrow, 1800–1911, p. 285
*21 August – Matthew Vaughan-Davies, 1st Baron Ystwyth, politician, 94

*18 February - by-election: Ernest Evans becomes Liberal MP for Cardiganshire, winning the seat vacated by Matthew Vaughan-Davies, 1st Baron Ystwyth, on the latter's elevation to the peerage.F W S Craig, British Parliamentary Election Results, 1918-1949; Political Reference Publications, Glasgow 1949 p550
*17 December - Matthew Vaughan-Davies, 1st Baron Ystwyth, politician (died 1935)
